TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/), the option in the Scatterer config: "autosavePlanetSettingsOnSceneChange = True" is the default setting. What is the benefit of this to a player/end user? Would it be more appropriate to set it to false by default and then let modders toggle it to true if they are doing dev work?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Gordon Dry said:
> 
> 
> It's very difficult to catch a lightning with a screenshot, but here is one, to the right :  
> [![tP97bqa.png](http://i.imgur.com/tP97bqa.png)](http://i.imgur.com/tP97bqa.png "Enlarge image")
> 

The visual pack you are using is a repackage of astronomers visual pack(renamed to andromeda for whatever reason) and lightning is a feature of that mod. It has nothing to do with scatterer. in regard to your null refs, remove that visual pack, install default <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> and see if the problem persists. I'm fairly certain that the issue is andromeda and the fact that it still uses KVE.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Gordon Fecyk said:
> 
> 
> [@Gordon Dry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163177-gordon-dry/) might mean [this sort of thing](https://youtu.be/TRPEBCUZYi4?t=7m38s). It's more a rapid change of brightness experienced with the <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> clouds. That example is from KSP 1.1.3, and I can see how these might get coloured with the current Scatterer
> 

That is just a poorly made cloud texture. Default EVEseems to do that, and SVE had it for a while. EVEs particle shader is very particular and doesn't like textures that don't stretch to the edge of the canvas.

> 
>

What is the benefit of this to a player/end user? Would it be more appropriate to set it to false by default and then let modders toggle it to true if they are doing dev work?
> 

People complaining that they changed some settings and lost their changes on scene change, that's it.

I seem to have started getting square plates of the terrain split off and float up, somewhat like an Album Cover. It is hard to explain further. It is definitely an issue with Scatterer, as disabling the mod stops the plates of terrain from flying around. Should be noted that these floating plates does not have any collision, it is purely a visual bug.

Mountains on horizon are flickering (scattering flickering on it). Please note I use KScale64 (which uses Sigma Dimesions and Kopernicus) to rescale 6.4X

No flicker in .275

KSP version is 1.3, 300 and 320 scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> regular config.

May be I need to tweak some settings? I know you don't support rescales, but kindly ask your advice.

New version is soo cool and I think perfomance improved a bit.

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) I love the new update, but the water refraction hurts performance a little more than I expected. I took some screenshots of the performance gap when they are turned on and when they are turned off:

Spoiler

Refractions OFF  
![uUJZ5Vn.png](http://i.imgur.com/uUJZ5Vn.png)

Refractions ON  
![hyP8UwZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/hyP8UwZ.png)

Its about a 15 fps difference, give or take a few fps. I have a pretty beefy setup, and this is completely playable for me, however, weaker systems will be whining ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") But on the bright side, disabling the refractions doesn't take away from from anything and being underwater looking up is still awesome!

I don't think there is much you can do to alleviate this, but perhaps put a warning in like you did for the pixel lights. I just don't want you to get bombarded with "scatterer kills my fps" comments.

Oh, and the white caps are still not working in this release. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

Overall, great release!

[@Rodger](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/153575-rodger/) I do no think this is a Scatterer issue. I am also on a mac running KSP v. 1.3 and I am encountering the exact same problem.

I took out <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE (v. 1.2.2-1)</abbr>, SVE (v. 1.2.4.1) and SVT (v. 2.0.4), leaving only Scatterer (v. 0.0320b) and Kopernicus (v. 1.3.0-4) installed. It worked perfectly well. The sun and the sun flares were beautiful.

I then incrementally added the other mods to see where things broke down.

1) Scatterer + <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> = No problem

2) Scatterer + SVT = Problem (sunny-side-up sun)

3) Scatterer + <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> + SVE = Problem (sunny-side-up sun)

So its something, I am guessing, to do with SVE / SVT. I also tried what you advised in the response to [@reavertm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/128692-reavertm/) in the SVT forum thread and it did not work (changing the texture resolutions and/or the .dds with .pngs along with adjusting the sun.cfg). ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

For the sun issue, I got it to work by doing the conversion to png in SVT, and also doing the in-game toggle as well. I think SVE also has dds versions as well ~~but I don't know where the config that points to those is~~. [@Chaumas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/179009-chaumas/) Found it, SVE\_JoolRings has a cfg which modifies the sun's textures, so SVE has the highest priority sun config by the looks of it. So try replacing those dds' with the pngs, and update the jool rings cfg. Or did you mean the atmosphere halos?
